title: Cyberpsychology
banerDescription: Explore the psychological aspects of digital technology use and the impact of the Internet on behavior and emotions.

description2: The postgraduate studies in "Cyberpsychology" focus on examining the interactions between humans and technology, with particular emphasis on the impact of digital technologies on behavior, emotions, and society. The program aims to prepare students for work in research, clinical, and industrial areas related to information and communication technologies (ICT).
description3: The study program is divided into three semesters, including theoretical lectures, practical workshops, seminars, and professional internships.
scheduleInfo: The third semester is dedicated to internships

faculty: The program will be conducted by a qualified team of specialists in the fields of psychology, computer science, cybersecurity, and other related disciplines. The faculty will include both academic lecturers and practitioners with many years of experience working with digital technologies.
practices:
• 50% - possibility to complete internships remotely at the MAGNOLIA Psychological and Pedagogical Counseling Center
  • The remaining 50% can be completed:
    • in home institutions in the form of additional classes or performed within the teaching load,
    • in educational institutions,
    • in counseling centers,
    • other.
evaluation: The assessment of learning outcomes will be based on: preparation of a project work in the area of Cyberpsychology.
jobOpportunities: Graduates of the "Cyberpsychology" program will be prepared to work in various sectors such as scientific research, education, technology industry, mental health, digital marketing, and the public sector. They can work as UX specialists, data analysts, online therapists, media psychology researchers, and technology and digital security consultants.
